result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dannie D Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dannie D Harris in court.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court vacates stayed warrant. Defendant does not qualify for SPD representation.

Court appoints Kirk Henley as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Henley accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $75.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 12/01/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dannie D Harris not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for indigency hearing.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. 
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 30.
Calendar call scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Calendar call on October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dannie D Harris appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for status of counsel. Court in jury trial with another matter and orders case adjourned. Defendant given next court date over the telephone.
Indigency hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dannie D Harris appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant informed the Court he has not contacted State Public Defender's Office to see if eligible. 
Court instructed defendant to contact SPD and passed case until 2:45 p.m.

--------------------------------------------------------

Case heard off the record at 2:45 p.m. appearances remain the same.
Defendant informed the Court that he needs to be interviewed by SPD to determine if eligible for SPD representation.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dannie D Harris in court.  Prosecuting attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant may qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/13/22 @ 1p
